publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-156 Rosie Kane: Student Protests in Iran—That the Parliament notes the student uprising in Tehran; calls on the Scottish Executive to make representation to the Home Office to impose a moratorium on the deportation of all Iranian asylum seekers and refugees; acknowledges that these brave students, currently protesting against privatisation measures at Tehran University, could soon be seeking asylum in the United Kingdom if they become subject to repression by the Iranian regime, and accords them due respect and sympathy if they are forced to seek refuge in the United Kingdom.

S2M-156 Rosie Kane: Student Protests in Iran—That the Parliament notes the student uprising in Tehran; calls on the Scottish Executive to make representation to the Home Office to impose a moratorium on the deportation of all Iranian asylum seekers and refugees; acknowledges that these brave students, currently protesting against privatisation measures at Tehran University, could soon be seeking asylum in the United Kingdom if they become subject to repression by the Iranian regime, and accords them due respect and sympathy if they are forced to seek refuge in the United Kingdom. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-156 Student Protests in Iran (lodged on 17 June 2003) Carolyn Leckie*, Frances Curran*
S2M-156 Student Protests in Iran (lodged on 17 June 2003) Ms Rosemary Byrne*
